author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an upper-case letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are upper-case.
- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- Package name similar to 25 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to XML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1. Normalized visual distance 1.83 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
  2. Similar to QML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1.
  3. Similar to MKL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1.
  4. Similar to LSL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to SMC. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to NMF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to AMD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to HSL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to FMI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to KLU. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to GSL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  12. Similar to VSL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  13. Similar to ISL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  14. Similar to ZMQ. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  15. Similar to SMM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  16. Similar to GMT. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  17. Similar to TMLE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  18. Similar to MLJ. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  19. Similar to GLM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  20. Similar to HAML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  21. Similar to YAML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  22. Similar to SBML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  23. Similar to TOML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  24. Similar to TSML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  25. Similar to KitML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

  </details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
KML is the format used by Google Earth.  A quick google search only contains hits about the KML format, so as far as I know, there's little room for ambiguity about what this package is.
Bump.  "KML" is more widely recognized than "Keyhole Markup Language" and thus "KML" would be how people search for this package.

title: New package: KML v0.1.0
